info.title: Microsoft Entra ID OAuth 2.0 Authorization Endpoint
info.description: This OpenAPI document describes the OAuth 2.0 authorization endpoint for Microsoft Entra ID. The endpoint is used to obtain authorization codes as part of the authorization code grant flow.

tenant.description: The tenant identifier. Can be 'common', 'organizations', 'consumers', or a specific tenant ID.

get.description: Initiates the OAuth 2.0 authorization code grant flow by redirecting the user to the Microsoft Entra ID sign-in page.

parameters.name: response_type
parameters.description: The type of response desired. For authorization code grant flow, this should be 'code'.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: The URI to redirect the user to after authorization is complete. Must match one of the redirect URIs registered for the application.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: A space-separated list of scopes that the application is requesting access to.

parameters.name: response_mode
parameters.description: Specifies the method that should be used to send the resulting token back to your app. Can be 'query', 'fragment', or 'form_post'.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: A value included in the request that is also returned in the token response. A randomly generated unique value is typically used to prevent cross-site request forgery attacks.

parameters.name: prompt
parameters.description: Indicates the type of user interaction that is required. Can be 'login', 'none', 'consent', or 'select_account'.

parameters.name: login_hint
parameters.description: Can be used to pre-fill the username/email address field of the sign-in page for the user, if you know their username ahead of time.

parameters.name: domain_hint
parameters.description: Provides a hint about the tenant or domain that the user should use to sign in. The value is a registered domain for the tenant.

parameters.name: code_challenge
parameters.description: Used to secure authorization code grant flow by using Proof Key for Code Exchange (PKCE). This is the Base64URL-encoded SHA256 hash of the code verifier.

parameters.name: code_challenge_method
parameters.description: The method used to encode the code verifier for the code challenge. Can be 'plain' or 'S256'. 'S256' is recommended.

302.description: Redirects the user to the Microsoft Entra ID sign-in page. Upon successful authentication and authorization, the user is redirected to the specified redirect_uri with an authorization code.

400.description: Bad Request. The request is missing a required parameter, includes an invalid parameter value, or is otherwise malformed.

401.description: Unauthorized. The client is not authorized to request an authorization code using this method.
